conclusion: Problem involves a computer-depicted x-t graph for a vehicle.
'Picture 1:' shows a graph with x-axis 't /s' and y-axis 'x / (m/s)'.
Straight line from t = -2 s and x/t = 0 m/s to t = 0 s and x/t = 10 m/s.
x/t on y-axis suggests velocity, not position.
'Picture 2:' shows similar graph with red dots at t = -2 s and t = 0 s.
Graph is likely a velocity versus time graph.
In velocity-time graph, slope represents acceleration.
Line goes from 0 m/s at t = -2 s to 10 m/s at t = 0 s.
Slope is Δv/Δt = 10 m/s / 2 s = 5 m/s².
Start of timing is t = 0 s.
Consider behavior of graph after t = 0 s.
'Picture 2:' shows dashed line and solid line beyond t = 0 s.
Dashed line indicates past motion, solid line indicates motion from t = 0 s onward.
Graph continues as straight line beyond t = 0 s, slope remains the same.
Car's acceleration from the start of timing is 5 m/s².
